name: William Green's Plan of Manchester & Salford (1787-94)
description: Comprehensive nine-sheet map drawn from actual survey, engraved by J. Thornton. Features street names, public buildings, landowners names, and proposed new streets. Decorative title with allegorical figures.
notes:
IIIF manifest: https://www.digitalcollections.manchester.ac.uk/iiif/PR-R-15369
9 sheets, 29 inches to the mile. Survey begun 1787, completed 1794.
Drawn by William Green, engraved by John Thornton.

IIIF image service per sheet:
  Sheet 1: https://image.digitalcollections.manchester.ac.uk/iiif/PR-R-15369-000-00001.jp2
  Sheet 2: ...00002.jp2
  Sheet 3: ...00003.jp2
  Sheet 4: ...00004.jp2
  Sheet 5: ...00005.jp2
  Sheet 6: ...00006.jp2
  Sheet 7: ...00007.jp2
  Sheet 8: ...00008.jp2
  Sheet 9: ...00009.jp2

AllMaps editor (all sheets via manifest):
https://editor.allmaps.org/#/georeference?url=https://www.digitalcollections.manchester.ac.uk/iiif/PR-R-15369

The earliest comprehensive large-scale survey of Manchester. Shows rivers, fields, gardens,
landowners, and the pre-industrial town layout. Pre-dates railway era by 40+ years.
